comments.author: Vampobit
comments.body: I don't own 1 BTC, but trust me, I don't really care about it. Bitcoin is, perhaps, the greatest technological invention of the century. I mean it! Imagine someone who invests in gold. They have to rent facilities to store it and guards to guard it. There is a storage issue. Bitcoin fixes that.Imagine someone who holds a large amount of money in their bank account and suddenly, their country decides to put capital controls and people can't withdraw their money. There is a liquidity issue. Bitcoin fixes that. Imagine someone who decides to send a payment to Africa and the banks require a 12% fee. There is a huge remmitance issue. Bitcoin fixes that.Imagine someone who wants to prove ownership of their property. There is a bureaucracy issue. Bitcoin fixes that.Imagine someone who sees their local currency being devastated by the exchange rates against dollar or euro. There is a massive attack on the local currency. Bitcoin fixes that.Imagine someone who holds lots of money in a bank account. If the government decide to inflate the monetary system, they can print money, causing people's money to lose its value. Bitcoin fixes that.Imagine lending money to someone and having to trust that they have the money to repay you. There is a trust issue. Bitcoin fixes that. In fact, Bitcoin solves the double-spending problem. Kudos to Satoshi and Adam Back.I believe in Bitcoin to be a superior monetary system, where everyone is equal. It's not about you and me, it's not about the people that have 100BTC, nor for those that have 100Sats. Every single one of us can be sovereign and maintain their own keys and their own nodes.Finally, Never forget how it all started "Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System" - Satoshi Nakamoto.
